title: Two teens injured in accidental shooting in Eastpointe
content:
Two male teenagers were hospitalized Thursday after being accidentally shot by another youth in Eastpointe, police reported.
Lt. Jason Gibson said a group of teenage males were playing with the gun at a house on the 22000 blocks of Hayes Road near Nine Mile Road about 3:30 p.m. when the shooting took place.
“One of the teens had his father’s firearm and didn’t know it was loaded,” Gibson said. “And the gun discharged, striking two of the teens.”
Eastpointe firefighters rendered medical care at the scene for the injured teens, ages 14 and 16.

The teens were then transported to St. John Hospital & Medical Center in Detroit, where they are reported to be in serious condition. Police described the teens’ injuries as being non life-threatening.
Gibson said the shooting is still under investigation, but police are treating it as an accidental discharge. He said criminal charges are unlikely, but added the investigation is still ongoing.
